meanings.definition: To fill or overpower with terror; terrify.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunder terrorized the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie terrorized the audience.
meanings.sent3: The prankster terrorized his friends by jumping out from behind a door.
meanings.sent4: The dark shadows in the forest seemed to terrorize the hikers' minds.
meanings.sent5: The sudden scream in the quiet night terrorized everyone in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To dominate or coerce by intimidation.
meanings.sent1: The bully terrorized the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The dictator terrorized the citizens into submission.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten terrorized the household by knocking things off shelves.
meanings.sent4: The aggressive competitor tried to terrorize his opponents with his fierce stare.
meanings.sent5: The aggressive driver terrorized other cars on the road with his reckless behavior.
